channel.title: The C64 Take-away podcast
channel.description: Commodore 64 remixes and original SID sounds to go!
channel.itunes:author: Jan Lund Thomsen
channel.itunes:subtitle: The best music from, or inspired by, the Commodore 64 home computer. Bringing you remixes for the 8-Bit generation and classic SID tunes recorded from the real thing. Plus background information, news, and exclusive previews from the http://Remix.Kwed.Org
channel.itunes:summary: The best music from, or inspired by, the Commodore 64 home computer. Bringing you remixes for the 8-Bit generation and classic SID tunes recorded from the real thing. Plus background information, news, and exclusive previews from the http://Remix.Kwed.Org upload queue and forthcoming remix CDs.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Episode 050: Redefining ‘infrequent’ since 2005
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Ho-ho-ho! Christmas comes a few days early this year. After passing my project manager exam on December 13th, I cleared the mountain of books and papers off my desk and started preparing this episode. In honour of this being the 50th show(!) here’s almost an hours worth of sonic delight – five remixes and five chiptunes, carefully selected for your enjoyment. And while the show doesn’t have a Christmas theme as such, the closing tune should be able to melt even the coldest of hearts and let the Commodore love flow freely. As usual mixed in with a brief recap of what’s been happening in the world of C64-related music. Enjoy!

Download or listen to the show (57:05, 102 Mb, MP3)

Music played:

  • moonove – Ace 2 – Main Theme (from Atari SID Remixes vol 2)
  • Encore – Run (Theme from Canabalt)
  • Rob Hubbard – Thing on a Spring
  • N-JOY – Warhawk (Halcón de la guerra mix)
  • Rob Hubbard – Thrust
  • Rayza – Oldschool (Wax To Binary Mix)
  • Jens-Christian Huus – Su-Sweet
  • Wobbler – Mountie Mick’s Deathride (Basstrail remix)
  • Jeroen Tel – Cybernoid II
  • Markus Schneider – Golden Axe (Christmas Edition)

Stuff mentioned:

  • C64 Take-away MySpace account closing at the end of 2011
  • Eve plays tune from The Last Ninja on a (badly tuned) piano
  • 18 classic SID tunes remastered and released on 2xLP (CD+download coming later)
  • C64 remix podcast “Commoflage” podcast (RSS feed)
  • Prince of Persia gets unofficial C64 port
  • Canabalt unofficial port
  • C64anabalt – official port
  • Please leave a review on iTunes and help others discover these great tunes.
  • Also, if you’re on Xbox Live and feel up for some online multiplayer action, look up “Don Kwed“.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or follow me on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway. And at the risk of repeating myself, please leave a review on iTunes.

item.title: Episode 049: Everybody set the 8-bit spirit free
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Greetings programmes! After another massive delay caused by too much going on at work, causing me to relax (among other things) in front of the Xbox rather than sit down in front of the microphone every month or two, here’s the first episode of 2011(!). Hopefully making up for the radio silence with nine carefully selected tunes – including not one, but two classic remixes. As usual mixed in with a brief recap of what’s been happening in the world of C64-related music.

Download or listen to the show (45:27, 65,2 Mb, MP3)

Music played:

  • Rob Rubbard – The Last V8
  • David Filskov – Firelord
  • Ziphoid: Back in the saddle
  • Chris Abbott & Rob Hubbard – Comets 97 (From the 1998 CD “Back In Time“)
  • Necropolo – Zak (McKrackenica edition)
  • Necropolo – BC Bill (Dreadnought)
  • Peter Clarke – Monty on the Run (Monty Gets Orchestrated 2011)
  • LMan & Sunflower – Follow me (Progressive Sample III)
  • DJ Skitz – MegaSweet

Stuff mentioned:

  • Markus Behlau (aka “Soundsosound”) – “8 2 88: 8-bit computer game tunes performed on 88 piano keys”
  • The new “Commodore 64″
  • Julian “Zzap!64″ Rignall is on Twitter
  • C64 remixing in 2010 infographic
  • More chipophone renditions from Linus Åkesson
  • Videos from Linus’ gig at the LCP 2011 party
  • The original “Back in Time” CD
  • Remix64.com
  • Remix64′s guide to digital audio mastering
  • The “HybridSID” portable C64 chiptune jukebox
  • Please leave a review on iTunes and help others discover these great tunes.
  • If you’re on Xbox Live and feel up for some online multiplayer action, look up “Don Kwed“.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or follow me on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway. And at the risk of repeating myself, please leave a review on iTunes.

item.title: Episode 048: And then there was one
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
In return for your patience with my completely erratic publishing schedule here is a little something for your Christmas stocking. Sadly, the (huge) delay is partly caused by the podcast going back to its single-host roots, as Makke has had to cancel his co-host gig. That being said, here’s eight carefully selected tunes that should put a smile on your face – including one that’s become a regular fixture at this time of year. And a brief recap of what’s been happening in the world of C64-related music. Enjoy!

Download or listen to the show (46:52, 68 Mb, MP3)

Music played:

  • Roman Majewski (Compod) – Mendacious
  • Laoudis – Law Of The West (Trigger Happy Version)
  • Linus Åkesson – Spellbound (Live on the Chipophone)
  • Moog – Rainbow Shuffle
  • Soundsosound – Forbidden Forest (Piano)
  • Vincenzo – Billig Oel
  • N-Joy – Eliminator (Sexy & Saxy Smooth Party remix)
  • André Müller (Crefelder) – Boing Doing (Airplay Mix)
  • Markus Schneider – Golden Axe (Christmas Edition)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Remix.Kwed.Org turned 10 years old on November 23rd 2009
  • PRESS PLAY ON TAPE‘s 10-year anniversary gig
  • Mind.In.A.Box’ “R.E.T.R.O” album (Remix64.com review, Listen on Spotify)
  • The Chipophone
  • Video: Linus Åkesson performs ‘Spellbound’ live on the Chipophone
  • The Chiptunes podcast
  • One Man & His Mic Season 2
  • Music Assembler re-released
  • Cubase64 demonstrates real-time digital audio processing – on a stock C64
  • Video: Cubase64 running on a C64
  • “Get Lamp” – brilliant text adventure documentary by Jason Scott
  • Please leave a review on iTunes and help others discover these great tunes.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or follow me on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway. And at the risk of repeating myself, please leave a review on iTunes.

item.title: Bad News, Everyone!
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
As some of you might have seen on our twitter feed, Operation Fatherhood has forced Makke to shelve his co-hosting of the #C64 Take-away. I only learned this a week ago myself (not the fatherhood bit – that’s been out in the open for a while) – and the news was a bit of a shock, truth be told. Rest assured that there aren’t any complications or anything of the sort – it’s just eating up his spare time, which babies have a tendency to do.

While I have managed to create the bulk of the show on my own in the past, I believe that Makke’s contribution has become an integral part of the podcast format since he joined up back in early 2009. Which makes it harder to go back to the old single-host formula. Sure, I might be able to get another co-host (although right now I have no idea who that would be) and set up a double ended recording to compensate for us being in different locations. But there’s something about being in the same room as your co-host that comes across in the final product.

Long story short, this leaves the podcast in the state that the old K Foundation poster referred to as a “major rethink in progress“.

In the meantime, please let me know what you think – either in the comments, via twitter, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway ->at<- gmail ->dot<- com. Thank you.

item.title: Episode 047: Just in time for Christmas
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Just in time for Christmas, Makke and Jan skip an obvious opportunity to pour themselves a generous helping of glühwein. Instead they get all serious (well, not really), and cook up a delicious Commodore 64 styled music burger for you: Two Christmas tunes make up the bun, a solitary SID chiptune provides the dressing, and between it a solid slab of meat mixed from shredded guitars, beatup drums, and pounded pianos. Also, to spice things up there’s C64-related “news”, feedback, and the usual banter on the side. And the “Classic Remix” segment takes us all the way back to 2001.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (56:54, 52 Mb)

Music played:

  • 8 Bit Weapon & ComputeHer – Jingle Bells (From the It’s a chiptune holiday album)
  • Alexander Rotzsch (Fanta) – Finetuning
  • NecroPolo – RoboCop ingame (RobbSpotter mix)
  • Mutherpluckin’ B – Deflektor (Deflektions of My Life) (also check out his NES remixes)
  • Vincenzo – InCompleeto
  • Classic remix: Jeroen Breebart – Special Agent 2001
  • Martin Dodd – The Running Man (ICS Prime Time Remix)
  • Markus Schneider – Golden Axe (Christmas Edition)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Remix.Kwed.Org turned 9 years old on November 23rd 2009
  • SOASC= got a new search engine and massive bandwidth upgrade.
  • Commoradio plays chiptunes from the SOASC= and SOAMC.
  • The Poke 20 album contains 21(!) remixes of Monty On The Run. And no mention of Rob Hubbard in the liner notes. And it violates its own Creative Commons license as well. Boo! Hiss!
  • Interview with the composer of “Future Shock” and other C64 and NES tracks, Neil Baldwin (aka Demon)
  • Necropolo’s “rakBIT” album released as a £4.50 digital download. You need to buy it! Now!
  • Armin Gessert passed away on November 8th 2009 (in German)
  • Giana Sisters is coming to the iPhone/iPod Touch (in German)
  • The C64 Take-away has been nominated for a European #Podcast Award. Help us rock the vote!
  • The Chameleon 64 cartridge contains a metric tonne of goodies: 1541 Emulator, REU, RetroReplay, VGA output, PS/2 mouse port, and more. Expected to ship in 2010, pre-order now for 219 EUR.
  • The C64 App is back on the iTunes App Store.
  • The free SID Player app should be on every iPhone/iPod Touch.
  • Got a jailbroken iPhone/iPod Touch? Install more games on the C64 app with @DNA64′s gamepack.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or follow us on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway.

  • The free SID Player app should be on every iPhone/iPod Touch.
  • Got a jailbroken iPhone/iPod Touch? Install more games on the C64 app with @DNA64′s gamepack.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or follow us on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway.
item.itunes:subtitle: Just in time for Christmas, Makke and Jan skip an obvious opportunity to pour themselves a generous helping of glühwein. Instead they get all serious (well, not really), and cook up a delicious Commodore 64 styled music burger for you: Two Christmas tune
item.itunes:author: Jan Lund Thomsen
item.itunes:summary: Just in time for Christmas, Makke and Jan skip an obvious opportunity to pour themselves a generous helping of glühwein. Instead they get all serious (well, not really), and cook up a delicious Commodore 64 styled music burger for you: Two Christmas tunes make up the bun, a solitary SID chiptune provides the dressing, and between it a solid slab of meat mixed from shredded guitars, beatup drums, and pounded pianos. Also, to spice things up there’s C64-related “news”, feedback, and the usual banter on the side. And the “Classic Remix” segment takes us all the way back to 2001. Download or listen to the MP3 here (56:54, 52 Mb) Music played: 8 Bit Weapon & ComputeHer – Jingle Bells (From the It’s a chiptune holiday album) Alexander Rotzsch (Fanta) – Finetuning NecroPolo – RoboCop ingame (RobbSpotter mix) Mutherpluckin’ B – Deflektor (Deflektions of My Life) (also check out his NES remixes) Vincenzo – InCompleeto Classic remix: Jeroen Breebart – Special Agent 2001 Martin Dodd – The Running Man (ICS Prime Time Remix) Markus Schneider – Golden Axe (Christmas Edition) Stuff mentioned: Remix.Kwed.Org turned 9 years old on November 23rd 2009 SOASC= got a new search engine and massive bandwidth upgrade. Commoradio plays chiptunes from the SOASC= and SOAMC. The Poke 20 album contains 21(!) remixes of Monty On The Run. And no mention of Rob Hubbard in the liner notes. And it violates its own Creative Commons license as well. Boo! Hiss! Interview with the composer of “Future Shock” and other C64 and NES tracks, Neil Baldwin (aka Demon) Necropolo’s “rakBIT” album released as a £4.50 digital download. You need to buy it! Now! Armin Gessert passed away on November 8th 2009 (in German) Giana Sisters is coming to the iPhone/iPod Touch (in German) The C64 Take-away has been nominated for a European #Podcast Award. Help us rock the vote! The Chameleon 64 cartridge contains a metric tonne of goodies: 1541 Emulator, REU, RetroReplay, VGA output, PS/2 mouse port, and more. Expected to ship in 2010, pre-order now for 219 EUR. The C64 App is back on the iTunes App Store. The free SID Player app should be on every iPhone/iPod Touch. Got a jailbroken iPhone/iPod Touch? Install more games on the C64 app with @DNA64′s gamepack. Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or follow us on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway.

item.title: Episode 046
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Just when you thought the C64 Take-away was back on a regular schedule, Makke and Jan go and mess it up again – this time blaming it on being extremely busy at work. To make things better, the lads provide you with the longest show so far, clocking in at just over an hours worth of C64 SIDs, remixes, and a couple of off-topic memories – including one about juggling floppies on the Amiga. Also, the “Classic Remix” is back by popular demand.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (1:01:39, 57 Mb)

Music played:

  • Søren “Jeff” Lund – Crossbow
  • LMan & Sunflower – Enigma Force
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Flimbo’s Quest (Live at the Church)
  • Hank – Yet Another Giana Sisters
  • Rune-Bertil’s – Pandora’s Ficka (Ark Pandora)
  • Wobbler – Max Headroom (research programme 9512 remix)
  • Slaygon and Reyn – Troll (Felix Culpa)
  • Monotron – Only You feat. Eliza Zoot (Downstairs @ Monty’s Mix) (From the Remix64 V3: Syntax Era album)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Zero Punctuations review of Tales of Monkey Island
  • The MSSIAH cart turns your C64 into a MIDI unit
  • SIDPlay 4.1.3 for Mac released.
  • Depeche Mode’s Martin Gore owns a SIDStation
  • iPhone C64 emulator came and went
  • Get your SID groove on courtesy of The Daily SID
  • Homebrew remake of Warhawk for NDS includes C64 remixes by Press Play On Tape and Spacefractal.
  • The top 10 tunes for each of the past 9 years of C64 remixing, packed into a handy torrent.
  • Optigan organ + Reyn Ouwehand = brilliant live rendition of Flimbo’s Quest
  • Droidsound plays SIDs on Android-powered phones

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway.

item.title: Episode 045
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Holy rapid release schedule, Batman! Another C64 Take-away already? Makke and Jan are back to entertain you with even more carefully selected C64 SIDs and remixes – including an 8-bit tribute to the man who came up with the moonwalk, and a trip back to the early days of remixing. Also, we talk about the BBC tuning into the chiptune/remix scene, and Apple not wanting people to run emulated 6510 assembly code on the iPhone.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (51:25 minutes, 47 Mb)

Music played:

  • Charles Deenen – Smooth Criminal (From the "Smooth Criminal" demo by Ash+Dave, recorded from a 6581R4 SID)
  • Sonic Wanderer – Druid II: Enlightenment (Turbo Edit)
  • Branko Balsic – Airscape Ride
  • André Müller (Crefelder) – Bomb Jack (Summer Radio Edit)
  • Sonic Wanderer – Great Giana Sisters (Pedal To The Metal Distortion Remix)
  • Hazel – Summer (Barbeque at Dafunks Beachhouse)
  • The Dead Guys – Arkanoid (Dubanoid mix)
  • Mixer – Alka

Stuff mentioned:

  • Listener reviews of the SIDPlayer for iPhone/iPod Touch.
  • Forthcoming firmware update for the 1541 Ultimate cartridge will include a SID player.
  • Remix.Kwed.Org staff take the summer off. No new uploads accepted until August 24th 2009.
  • The BBC’s "Digital Planet" featured a segment on chiptunes on their May 26th episode. No mention of the C64 SID/Remix scene, though.
  • The BBC’s "Pods and Blogs " programme is also keeping up with C64 music news by following us on Twitter.
  • C64 emulator rejected from the iTunes App store.
  • SOASC= goes ‘Gold’ + Stone Oakvally retires. No MP3s of C64 recordings after HVSC 49.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC recordings availble on the SOASC site. Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway.

item.title: Episode 044: Two hosts at the price of one
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Makke is back for another co-hosted episode, coming at you from cloudy Malmö, Sweden. This time we bring you no less than three tunes from the new "Sounds of SceneSat" compilation, along with some other remixes, and a great SID tune by AMJ. Plus, we catch up on whats been happening in the world of C64-related music during the past six months. Also, Jan tries to stop talking about Twitter.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (55:29 minutes, 50.9 Mb)

Music played:

  • AMJ – Pashaus (recorded from a 6581R2 SID. Check out the 6581R4 and 8580R5 versions on SOASC= or the HVSC for examples on how different SID revisions render the same tune)
  • Novaload – Sanxion
  • LMan – The Eidolon
  • J Kraft – Fist 2 (Four Degrees Dub RMX) (From The Sounds of SceneSat Vol. 1 )
  • Firestorm – Commando (From The Sounds of SceneSat Vol. 1 )
  • Moog – Funk Off (From The Sounds of SceneSat Vol. 1 )
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Ace II
  • Martin Dodd – Milk Race (Wrapped In Plastic Mix)
  • Kurrel the Raven – Parallax (Andes Ocarina mix)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Makke’s band – The Devil In Little Lisa
  • Jan bought an Xbox 360. Send friend-requests to "Don Kwed "
  • Rob Hubbards "Thalamusic " (possibly the first remix that Jan ever listened to)
  • The Sounds of Scenesat vol. 1
  • SceneSat Radio
  • HVSC update 50 released
  • The ultimate jukebox: Stick the HVSC on an SD card, mount card in a MMC Replay or 1541 Ultimate cartridge (which Jan managed to refer to as "MMC64" and "1541-III Ultimate") and have instant access to the entire HVSC on your C64.
  • SceneTone plays .SID files on your Symbian S60 mobile
  • SIDPlayer for the iPod Touch/iPhone
  • Remix64 vol. 3: Syntax Era and 8 Bit Weapon : Confidential 2.0 are now available on the iTunes Store and Amazon MP3s
  • The C64 Take-away is on Twitter

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , or from the HVSC . Leave feedback either by using the comment section at http://C64Takeaway.com , by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or on Twitter at http://twitter.com/C64Takeaway .

item.title: Episode 043
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Okay, so you’ve waited patiently for a new episode to come out before. But never this long. Tune in to hear what could possibly distract me from producing an episode for over four months (hint: it involves lots of people, a church, and saying "I do!"). Plus news, feedback, and the usual funky fry up of SIDs and remixes.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (44:25 minutes, 40.7 Mb)

Music played:

  • André Müller (Crefelder) – Shards
  • Vincenzo – Swing ReRemixed
  • 8 Bit Weapon – Chimera (Miles Mix) – from the Confidential 2.0 album
  • Carsten Pedersen – Bruce Lee (CPU1970 mix)
  • BeeZerk – Tintin On The Moon
  • The Mighty Bogg – Shoe 2008
  • Anthony Crowther – Zig Zag
  • Trauma – Sanxoid
  • The C64Mafia – Paperboy (So you don’t like rap music)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Back In Time 2008 images and videos
  • DSOrganise plays .SID files on the Nintendo DS
  • "The 8-Bit Philosophy" documentary available for download
  • Seth "8 Bit Weapon" Sternbergers "Confidential 2.0" album

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , and from the HVSC . Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified).

item.title: Episode 042
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Just when you thought it was safe to unsubscribe, the C64 Take-away is back to serve you another nutritious audio fry up. Once again I stumble my way through the English language, bringing you carefully selected Commodore 64 SID tunes and remixes, lovingly spiced with news on whats happening in the world of Commodore-related music.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (44:30 minutes, 41 Mb)

Music played:

  • Peter W – I Love My 64 (Feat. Slaygon)
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Cauldron II [live at The Church]
  • Makke – Forbidden Forest (Spider Surfin’)
  • Rob Hubbard – Master of Magic
  • Chronberg – Great Gurianos (CyberJungle remix)
  • PowerTrace – ACE 2 (feat. Kate Lesing)
  • Tron – Loading Green Beret (Takes Too F**king Long RMX)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Remixer of the Year 2007 results .
  • Reyn Ouwehand’s fantastic one-man-band tunes .
  • Press Play On Tape’s 80s medley on Youtube .
  • Swedish NES cover band Powerplay .
  • FrodoDS runs C64 games on your Nintendo DS, including my all-time favorite: Laser Squad .
  • SIDPlay 4.0 for Mac OS X 10.5.
  • High Voltage SID Collection update 48.
  • Shredz64 – Hook a Guitar Hero controller up to your C64 and rock out.
  • Syntax Era ships on CD (MP3/FLAC downloads also available). Also on MySpace . And don’t forget to spread the word about the album using one of the available banners .
  • Back in Time Live Stockholm 2008 .
  • SLAY Radio Gathering 2008 .
  • Synergy’s Audion album.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org , and from the HVSC . Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message .

item.title: Episode 041
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Told you the C64 Take-away would be back in February, didn’t I? The first show for 2008 features a bit of catch-up on what’s been happening in the world of C64 related music – including two new album releases, a hardware gizmo that will let you musician types use that sweet SID sound in your work, and a couple of upcoming live concerts. Plus of course, lots and lots of great tunes carefully selected for your listening pleasure.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (50:34 minutes, 46.4 Mb)

Music played:

  • Thomas Detert – BMX Kidz (from the album Syntax Era)
  • MarkG – Parallax Melody (alto sax)
  • BeeZerk – Lets Fly (Skyhigh)
  • Hank (Lukasz Drzewiecki) – Yet Another Giana Sister
  • The C64 Orchestra – Delta High Score (from the album RUN 10)
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Green Beret [live at The Church] (The video footage of Reyn’s performance is also a must-see)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Syntax Era album available for preorder and instant MP3/FLAC download.
  • RUN 10 album available on CD and on iTunes (DRM-free even)
  • Preorder the HardSID 4U if you’re a musician looking for the authentic SID touch.
  • Carry the entire High Voltage SID Collection around on your iPod (or other Rockbox compatible mp3 player) – also see this announcement.
  • PRESS PLAY ON TAPE live at The Rock in Copenhagen/Denmark on April 19th. Tickets from BilletLugen.dk.
  • Symphonic Shades – Chris Huelsbeck in Concert. Cologne/Germany, August 23rd.
  • The Raven and the Blues podcast.

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

item.title: Episode 040: Is there life after forty?
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
This time bringing you a bunch of tunes that have nothing in common apart from the fact that the original SIDs were all composed between 1984 and 1986. Also, I talk about an upcoming album release, and mention a couple of videos that you need to watch.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (37:08 minutes, 34.1 Mb)

Please notice that I’ll be taking a three month break from the podcast starting November 1st. But fear not, the Take-away will be back in February 2008. Stay subcribed to the RSS feed or the mailing list to get an alert when the show’s back on the air.

Music played:

  • David Hanlon – Druid
  • J Rooney – Zorro (Small Ensemble)
  • FTC – Comic Bakery (Electro) (from the album 01:04 Eternal)
  • Allister Brimble – Green Beret Full Orch -
  • Rauli – Spy vs Spy II (Late Nite Mellow)
  • Terminal Storm – Glider Rider (Gliding into a Sunset mix)

Stuff mentioned:

  • P.W. Fenton from Perfect Head and Digital Flotsam let me use the intro-jingle from Perfect Head #16. Thanks P-Dub.
  • New video from Reyn Ouwehand
  • Rob Hubbard – On the Golden days of computer game music
  • On The Edge available from Amazon UK
  • Andrew Fishers “The Commodore Book 1982-19xx”

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

item.title: Episode 039: From deep within the Swedish woods (Fixed version)
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
(Eek! I managed to mess up the volume level in post-production when I first put this one out. Here’s the fixed version for your enjoyment.)

Time for another irregularly scheduled dose of the best remixes out there. This time the show is produced and assembled on my laptop, using different recording gear and software from the stuff I’m used to, so apologies in advance if it’s not up to standard, sound quality wise.

Also included is another track from the new Reyn Ouwehand album, a look back at both the Back In Time Live 2007 and SLAY Radio Gathering 2007 events, as well as recent news and listener feedback.

Download or listen to the MP3 here (35:13 minutes, 32.3 Mb)

Music played:

  • Jeroen Tel – Unnamed SID (Live from Utrecht, September 2006)
  • Nada – Bossa ‘n Goblins
  • The St. Albans Rob Hubbard Fan Club – Ace 2
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Garfield (from the album The Blithe, the Blend and the Bizarre)
  • Peter W – Paradroid
  • M.J. Hibbett – Hey Hey 64K (demo, from the CD single The Lesson of the Smiths)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Full unrestricted version of SID2MIDI
  • HVSC update #47
  • Warren Pilkingtons BITLive 2007 report
  • Andrew Fishers BITLive 2007 report
  • Photos from BITLive 2007
  • BITLive 2007 DVD bittorrent download
  • SLAY Radio Gathering 2007

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

item.title: Episode 038: Baby, it’s hot in here!
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
This time it’s the usual blend of classic SIDs and remixes. I also preview the new album from Reyn Ouwehand, talk about the upcoming Back In Time Live event, catch up on news and listener feedback, and play you a Nelly Futardo track[*] without getting in trouble with the RIAA.

Download the MP3 here (43:17 minutes, 39.7 Mb)

Music played:

  • Martin Walker – Snare
  • The St. Albans Rob Hubbard Fan Club – I-Ball
  • Nada – Crimson Games
  • Stanislaw Ostazewski – Resolution
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Ghosts’n Goblins (from the upcoming album The Blith, The Blend & The Bizarre)
  • Moog and Hazel – Acid Jazz (Grand Theft Audio)

Stuff mentioned:

  • Stone Oakvalley’s Authentic SID Collection
  • C64audio.com site relaunch
  • Back In Time Live 2007
  • Full two-hour video of Press Play On Tape’s Breakpoint ’07 concert

Unless otherwise stated tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

[*] The Nelly Futardo track in question ripped off a C64 track without asking for permission or even crediting the original composer/performer. The remix featured on todays episode is based on the same source material – but I’m giving full credit. In other words: back off, lawyers.

item.title: Episode 037: In memory of Richard Joseph
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
On the afternoon of March 4th 2007, veteran composer Richard Joseph passed away, after a short battle with lung cancer. I had the good fortune of meeting Richard at Back In Time London in 2002, and he left a lasting impression – although we only talked briefly I have fond memories of a man who despite his status as a legend was the most down-to-earth chap you’d ever come across. Our thoughts go out to Richards friends and family.

Join in as Makke and I pay tribute with a podcast entirely dedicated to the works of Richard Joseph, both the way he created the tunes himself, and the way other people interpreted his work.

Download the MP3 here (26:14 minutes, 24,1 Mb)

More information available on Remix64, EuroGamer.net, GamesIndustry.biz, and Wikipedia. Also be sure to check out the remixes of his tunes on Remix.Kwed.Org.

Music played:

  • Richard Joseph – Rimrunner (Title)
  • Makke – Sacred Armour of Antiriad (from the It’s Binary, Baby! album)
  • Richard Joseph – Sacred Armour of Antiriad
  • Trauma – I’m a Pumpkin Man (Cauldron II)
  • Richard Joseph – Cauldron II
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Stifflip & Co.
  • Richard Joseph – Stifflip & Co.
  • Richard Joseph and Jon Hare – War never been so much fun! (theme from Cannon Fodder – there’s even a music video for it.)

Tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

LAST MINUTE ADDITION: After production on this episode finished I noticed that the 8Bit Mayhem podcast has also released an episode dedicated to the memory of Richard Joseph.
item.content:encoded:
On the afternoon of March 4th 2007, veteran composer Richard Joseph passed away, after a short battle with lung cancer. I had the good fortune of meeting Richard at Back In Time London in 2002, and he left a lasting impression – although we only talked briefly I have fond memories of a man who despite his status as a legend was the most down-to-earth chap you’d ever come across. Our thoughts go out to Richards friends and family.

Join in as Makke and I pay tribute with a podcast entirely dedicated to the works of Richard Joseph, both the way he created the tunes himself, and the way other people interpreted his work.

Download the MP3 here (26:14 minutes, 24,1 Mb)

More information available on Remix64, EuroGamer.net, GamesIndustry.biz, and Wikipedia. Also be sure to check out the remixes of his tunes on Remix.Kwed.Org.

Music played:

  • Richard Joseph – Rimrunner (Title)
  • Makke – Sacred Armour of Antiriad (from the It’s Binary, Baby! album)
  • Richard Joseph – Sacred Armour of Antiriad
  • Trauma – I’m a Pumpkin Man (Cauldron II)
  • Richard Joseph – Cauldron II
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Stifflip & Co.
  • Richard Joseph – Stifflip & Co.
  • Richard Joseph and Jon Hare – War never been so much fun! (theme from Cannon Fodder – there’s even a music video for it.)

Tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Leave feedback either by using the comment section, or by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

LAST MINUTE ADDITION: After production on this episode finished I noticed that the 8Bit Mayhem podcast has also released an episode dedicated to the memory of Richard Joseph.

item.title: Episode 035
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (40:00 minutes, 36.7 Mb)

Yah, it’s the first show this year. Real life’s been keeping me occupied lately, but sometimes you just gotta take a break, switch on the mixer, put on the headphones and again bring you some of the best SIDs and remixes out there. Enjoy!

Stuff mentioned:

  • Yours truly talks about the C64 Take-away, SIDs and Remixes in todays edition of Harddisken on Danish National radio.
  • HVSC Update #46 released
  • Remixer of the Year 2006 winners announced
  • Remixer of the Year 2007 Voting now opened
  • Timbaland in unauthorised SID usage allegations
  • Video of Reyn Ouwehand playing all the instruments on Garfield

Music played:

  • Markus Holler – Moments of Everydayness
  • Binster – Ghouls and Ghosts Poltergeist Mix
  • MRT – To be on top
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Garfield
  • Dafunk – For Paradize
  • Glenn Rune Gallefoss – Acid Jazz 64

Tunes played on todays show are available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, and from the HVSC. Commments either right here at the site, by e-mail to C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, or via the Messageboard, or PodcastAlley.com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map (be sure to add a shout-out otherwise I won’t get notified) or even send me a voice message.

item.title: Episode 025: The SIDelicious Special
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (44:26 minutes, 40.7 Mb)

Wahey! The C64 Take-away is 25 shows old. Join me for an all-SIDs episode featuing some of my favorite tunes, recorded directly from the C64 sound chip.

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • The BoulderDash music video
  • GoatTracker 2.25
  • SIDPLAY V3.4 for OS X
  • Quicktime movie of the new Spotlight search feature
  • Think Commodore
  • sid.oth4.com

Music played:

  • Rob Hubbard – Rasputin
  • David Whittaker – Max Headroom
  • Ben Daglish – Last Ninja – The Wastelands
  • Fred Gray – Mutants
  • Neil Baldwin – Future Shock
  • Martin Galway – Wizball High-score theme

Tunes played on todays show are available for in the High Voltage SID Collection.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map.

item.title: Episode 021: The Metal Special, Part II
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (43:53 minutes, 40.2 Mb)

While everyone else in this country was watching the royal babtism on telly I put on my best growling voice (which is not very good, since I still have a cold) and produced an all-out metal edition of the C64 Take-away. If you prefer your remixes without screaming guitars, don’t worry – things will be back to normal on the next show.

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • Remixer Of The Year 2005
  • Copenhagen Retro Concert video bootleg (in the audio/video section)
  • The Tim Follin Arrangement Project
  • Rob Hubbard and Jeroen Tel will be arranging a performance of their classic tunes for a 12 piece orchestra
  • SIDin magazine

Music played:

  • Sid Peasley – Enigma Force
  • Sid Peasley – Flimbos Quest
  • X-formZ – Druid II (Epic Darkness)
  • Bitcrusher – Maniac Mansion (Meteor Edit)
  • X-formZ – Blood Valley (It’s the Journey)
  • Romeo Knight – Speedball (feat. Patman)
  • machinae supremacy – Sidology 2 Trinity

Everything available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also leave a Gizmo Project voicemail to “c64takeaway” or add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map.

item.title: Episode 020
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (50:54 minutes, 46.7 Mb)

First show of the year, and the biggest one I’ve done so far, too – clocking in at just below 51 minutes. Bear with me as I’ve become a tad rusty since the last show. It can only get better from here on in.

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • Makke’s “Artura (Dublin Delight mix)” gets airplay on Irish Music Podcast.
  • Rob Hubbard’s Return soundbank released for QuadraSID.
  • The C64 Take-away frappr map.

Music played:

  • Endrody Gabor – Armageddon Man ( Orchestral for a Cello )
  • Richard Rinn (Deek) – Weebles
  • Chronblom – Geo-Matrix (Schizophonic version)
  • Tokafondo – Ocean Loader 3 (taking it easy remix)
  • Dafunk – Space of Chaos (Do or Die remix)
  • bloomer – Athena (Tigress Remix v2.0)

Everything available for download from Remix.Kwed.Org, except Weebles which you can find in the High Voltage SID Collection.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also leave a Gizmo Project voicemail to “c64takeaway” or add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map.

item.title: Episode 018
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (34:56 minutes, 32.0 Mb)

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • Swedish television programme “Kontroll” talk to Andreas Wahlström about C64hq, SID’80s, the SID-chip, his C64 collection and more. Airs Monday, December 5th, SVT2 at 8:30 pm CET and available here the following day (requires RealPlayer or Windows Media Player.)
  • The C64 Take-away frappr map

Music played:

  • Rob Hubbard – Phantom of the Asteroids (1986)
  • Rob Hubbard – Phantom of the Asteroids (1983 Synth version)
  • Matti Paalanen – Nodes of Yesod
  • Flat Four Radio – Chiptunes: Commodore (excerpt)
  • Sonic Wanderer – Green Beret (Distant Dreams)

Phantom of the Asteroids is available in the High Voltage SID Collection, Phantom of the Asteroids (1983 Synth version) is available on C64hq.com. Flat Four Radio’s Chiptunes Commodore available from OurMedia.org. Everything else can be downloaded from Remix.Kwed.Org.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also leave a Gizmo Project voicemail to “c64takeaway” or add your pushpin to the C64 Take-away frappr map.

item.title: Episode 017
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (36:44 minutes, 33.7 Mb)

A bit more nasal than usual, as I haven’t completely gotten rid of the flu that I caught a week back.

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • The Copenhagen Retro concert gets coverage on Danish national radio (Requires Windows Media Player. This is mostly in Danish, but it does have interviews with Rob Hubbard and Jeroen Tel that are well worth waiting for. )
  • CRC setlists
  • CRC photo galleries
  • PocketSID

Music played:

  • Jeroen Tel – Rubicon
  • DJ Mitch – Wings of Fury (Orchestral)
  • o2 – Monty on the Run
  • Sonic Remedy – My Last Ninja
  • Putzi – Underground (feel the warmth)
  • Trez – Robocop (Rainy Day Renegade)

Rubicon is available in the High Voltage SID Collection, . Everything else can be downloaded from Remix.Kwed.Org.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also leave a Gizmo Project voicemail to “c64takeaway”.

item.title: Episode 016
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (35:58 minutes, 33 Mb)

Sure, it’s 3 weeks later than planned, but you wouldn’t believe the stuff I’ve had to endure since last time the Take-away was open for business. Oh well, such is karma. Or summat.

Almost the start of a new month, don’t forget to vote for the Take-away on PodcastAlley.com once November starts (and every 1st of the month after that.).

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • Sturgeons Law podcast
  • Yahoo! Podcasts page for the C64 Take-away
  • C64 used in the public transport system in Brisbane/Australia
  • Add the Take-away to your PodcastPickle.com favorites list

Music played:

  • Rob Hubbard – The Last V8
  • Chronblom – Block’n Bubble (Carbonated version)
  • Axes Denied – Bubble Bobble
  • PRESS PLAY ON TAPE – Defender of the Crown
  • Visa Röster – Thrust
  • Subversive Elements – Rambo Loader (Rambo’s Blue Monday Mix)

The Last V8 is available in the High Voltage SID Collection, Defender of the Crown is from the RUN-STOP/RESTORE album, and Trust is from Visa Rösters upcoming album “READY. Vocally Too“- on sale from november 5th at the Copenhagen Retro Concert and on the web from the band website later on. Everything else can be downloaded from Remix.Kwed.Org.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also leave a Gizmo Project voicemail to “c64takeaway”.

item.description: Sorry about the hiatus, everyone. Lots of real-life issues popping up since last time I did a show. But fear not; the C64 Take-away will be back sooner rather than later – hopefully this next weekend, asuming I pass a certification test on Friday
item.content:encoded: Sorry about the hiatus, everyone. Lots of real-life issues popping up since last time I did a show. But fear not; the C64 Take-away will be back sooner rather than later – hopefully this next weekend, asuming I pass a certification test on Friday

item.title: Episode 015: The Hip-hop Special
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (37:28 minutes, 34.4Mb)

Def rhymes and phat beats, as the Take-away goes allout hip-hop. And no, on show #014 I didn’t play Linus Walleijs “Wares the Phuture” to drive away the north-american audience.

And since its the start of a new month, don’t forget to vote for the Take-away on PodcastAlley.com if you dig the show.

Music played:

  • Selectanovel – Huerdenlauf
  • The C64 Mafia – Forbidden Forest (Live at BITLive2004)
  • DHS of TSW feat. Papa Sid – BreakDance (Wild Coiffeur Remix)
  • Mythril Nazgul – Paperboy (Smoother Delivery Edit)
  • The C64Mafia – Crappy (I’d Like to Be Your Enemy)
  • Mahoney – Miss ParkPatrol takes a Break (feat. Elsa Persson)
  • The C64Mafia – Deathwish 3 (Keep them discs spinning)(Live at BITLive2004)

Huerdenlauf found on VGMix.com, BITLive tracks from the BITLive DVD set, Everything else can be downloaded from Remix.Kwed.Org.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard, or on PodcastAlley.com. You can also leave a Gizmo Project voicemail to “c64takeaway”.

First show this month. Don’t forget to cast your vote on Podcastalley if you like the C64 Take-away. Of course if you’re feeling lazy you can just key in your e-mail address on the vote form on this page to do your bit to spread the gospel.

Stuff mentioned on todays show:

  • Retro Survival
  • “From Rags to Riches” – Pretty good summary of the past five years of remixing
  • Back In Time Lite/Retrovision

  • Animal of Defect – Outrun SplashWave (Klappstullen-Remix)
  • Dafunk – Synergetic (Guitar rmx)

  • Mahoney – M.U.L.E (Aerobics in the jungle mix)
  • Stanissaw ‘Ini’ Ostaszewski – Upfront
  • Chronblom – Bomb Jack subtune 6 (violin version)
  • Glyn R Brown – The Recovery

Rain is available in the High Voltage SID Collection. Everything else can be downloaded from Remix.Kwed.Org.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard or on PodcastAlley.com

item.title: Be part of episode #010
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (0:47 minutes, 0.7Mb)

On Saturday August the 20th I’ll be recording the C64 Take-away episode #010… So, if you want to be part of next weeks podcast and join me in celebrating the show count reaching double digits here’s your chance to participate. Simply record your thoughts on the Take-away and e-mail it to podcast AT slayradio DOT org.

The deadline for your submission is Friday August 19th at 8 PM Central European Time.

See ya in a week.

On todays show:

  • Westerling – Game Over
  • Juha Kaunisto – Calm
  • Aki Kivela – Commando (Run Gun Shoot Remix)
  • Rob Hubbard – Sanxion (Live @ BITLive Brighton 2003)
  • Wobbler – Foreign Girl (Kim Nichols mix)
  • Sapa – Spy vs. Spy2 (WahWah mix)

All tunes played on todays show are freely available from Remix.Kwed.Org, with the exception of Sanxion (available on the Retro Revival Issue 4 CD and on the upcoming Back In Time Live DVD) and Nemesis the Warlock (available on the Remix64 album).

More information on the Classic Gaming Expo UK at http://www.cgeuk.com/

Check out the Back in Time Live DVD disc artwork by Mark Hennessy-Barrett.

item.title: Episode 007: The Parallax Special
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (47:09 minutes, 43.2Mb)

47 minutes worth of C64 remix goodies – the biggest show yet. All tunes on todays edition originally composed by Martin Galway. Plus: listener feedback, news, and the usual “It’s a new month, so please vote for the C64 Take-away on Podcastalley” plea. Yep, a new month has rolled by, which means that everyones votes has been reset. Make a difference – Vote for the C64 Take-away on PodcastAlley.com.

On todays show:

  • Instant Remedy – Ocean Loader V2
  • No Other Medicine – Parallax
  • Tokafondo – Parallax unplugged
  • Orpheus – Parallax visions (from the Crystal Dreamscapes CD)
  • Linus Akesson – Parallax For Piano (Score transcript)

All remixes available from Remix.Kwed.Org with the exception of “Parallax Visions” which comes off the Crystal Dreamscapes album. Back In Time Lite / Retrovision 6 tickets available from C64audio.com where you can also preorder the BITLive DVD.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard or on PodcastAlley.com

item.title: Episode 004: The Whittaker Special
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (30 minutes, 28 Mb)

All tunes on todays show composed by David Whittaker. As usually crafted, produced, presented, and recorded in one take by Remix.Kwed.Org head honcho and all-around nice guy Jan “Kwed” Lund Thomsen.

A new month has rolled by, which means the PodcastAlley.com votes are reset. So please head over there and let yourself be heard if you dig the show.

On todays show:

  • Q – Street Surfer
  • 2Klang – Slaine (Industriemadchen Mix)
  • Makke – Glider Rider
  • /Whittaker_David/Max_Headroom.sid
  • Wobbler – Max Headroom (research programme 9512)
  • Glyn R Brown – Storm
  • Visa Röster – Armageddon Man

All remixes available from Remix.Kwed.Org, except for Makkes “Glider Rider”, Glyn Browns “Storm” and Visa Rösters “Armageddon Man”

Storm is from “Remix 64 – 80s remixes for the 8-bit generation”. You can get it from C64Audio.com.

Armageddon Man can be found on Visa Rösters‘s album “C64 Vocally”. It’s available directly from their website for a measly 14 Euros including shipping and handling.

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard or on PodcastAlley.com (where you can also vote for the show )

item.title: Episode 003: The Metal Special
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
MP3 (20:06 minutes, 18.5 Mb)

Loud vocals featuring the F-word, and lots of electrified guitarwork as the C64 Take-away adds a Metal Special to the menu. As usually crafted, produced, presented, and recorded in one take by Remix.Kwed.Org head honcho and all-around nice guy Jan “Kwed” Lund Thomsen.

One minor disclaimer: It seems that without me noticing it I managed to speak in my “announcer / home shopping network presenter” voice all through the show. Must be the excitement of knowing you people dig the podcast. I’ll try to sound normal next time.

On todays show:

  • Juha Kaunisto – 720 degress (Still loading…)
  • Rob Hubbard – Arcade Classics
  • Romeo Knight – Human Race (tune 5)
  • KryogeniK – Deflektor (in your face mix)
  • Machinae Supremacy – Sidology Episode 3 – Apex Ultima

Plus the usual yakking – I get plugged on VGDJ episode #5, listener stats update, and a call for feedback: Please let me know how you found the podcast and how/where you listen to it.

All remixes available from Remix.Kwed.Org. Thanks to Kenz from Binary Zone Interactive for recording the Arcade Classics tune off a genuine C64 for use in todays show. Grab the SID file from HVSC.

Machinae Supremacy‘s album “Deus ex Machinae” can be bought from MBD Records (edit: since MBD Records closed up shop in early July you can’t get the album anywhere right now.)

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com, the Messageboard or on PodcastAlley.com (where you can also vote for the show )

item.title: PodcastAlley.com voting
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Don’t forget to cast your vote on Podcastalley if you like the C64 Take-away. No registration needed (although you can register to avoid having future voting verified via e-mail) – just click the “vote now!” button, key in a valid address, and click the confirmation link they e-mail you.

The way their system works is that the number of montly votes are used to determine show popularity both overall and in terms of the category it’s listed under (in this case music/radio). The higher the show ranks, the easier it is for people to find it. And the more people that tune in, the more people might be hooked. Which in turn could lead to new blood for the community. Who knows – we might even get more people to produce kick-ass remixes?

So you see – you’re not doing this for me – you’re doing it for yourself.

item.title: Episode 001
item.dc:creator: C64Takeaway@gmail.com (Jan Lund Thomsen)
item.description:
Time for the C64 to hit the pod-o-sphere. Kicking it off with 23 minutes of talking about and playing C64 tunes, both in original and remix form. Perfect for your morning commute. Created, produced and presented by Jan Lund Thomsen from Remix.Kwed.Org.

I just want to apologize in advance for all the “ahm” and “umn”‘s in this show. Taking into account that I was a tad nerveous when recording this (in one take) and that English isn’t my native language I think I did pretty okay. =)

Commments either by e-mail at C64Takeaway [AT] gmail [DOT] com or at the Remix64.com Messageboard

On todays show:

  • DJ Pretzel – Bubble Bobble (Hillbilly Rodeo OC ReMix)
  • Johannes Bjerregaard – Pimplesqueezer 6, pt. 3
  • Reyn Ouwehand – Pimplesqueezer (from the Nexus 6581-II EP
  • David Whittaker – Max Headroom
  • Das Karl Werk Projekt – Elektro Lok (Allgemeine Frequenz)
  • Rayza – Oldschool (Wax To Binary Mix)

MP3 (21,7 Mb – 23:41 minutes)
